ARTICLE.TITLE: RI School Start Could Be Delayed | Patch PM
ARTICLE.TEXT:
© Shutterstock / SewCream Gov. Gina Raimondo is expected to discuss a possible delay in the first day of school in Rhode Island during her weekly news conference.

Welcome to Tuesday's edition of Patch PM. Here's a look at today's top headlines.

Gov. Gina Raimondo is expected to discuss the issue at this week's news conference.

Rhode Islanders still must quarantine or prove a negative coronavirus test when going to Massachusetts.

P-Bruins say the award will go to the Providence player who is dedicated to community service and helping RI charitable organizations.

The Rhode Island Attorney General's Office said a sentence enhancement will be pursued against Richard Gordon, 71, of Rumstick Drive.
